# selector

**Instance Property**

The method that performs the action.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var selector: Selector { get set }
```

## Discussion

The signature of the selector must take one of the following forms:

```objc
- (BOOL)myPerformActionMethod
- (BOOL)myPerformActionMethod:(UIAccessibilityCustomAction *)action
```

When the user selects a custom action, the assistive technology calls the specified method of the object in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAccessibilityCustomAction/target] property. Use your method to perform the indicated action.

## Accessing the action parameters

- **name**: The localized name of the action.
- **attributedName**: The localized name of the action as an attributed string.
- **image**: An image that represents the action in assistive apps.
- **actionHandler**: A handler to perform for the action.
- **target**: The object that performs the action.
- **UIAccessibilityCustomAction.Handler**: A closure type that defines a handler to perform for an action.
